New Records: The Chicago White Sox tied the record for most losses with the 1962 New York Mets at 120 losses, with one more loss needed to break the record
Key Match Events: The White Sox scored seven runs in the fifth inning, their best inning of the entire season, to cap off a sweep of the Los Angeles Angels
Pre-Game Insights: Fans were hoping for a record-breaking loss at home, rather than on the road in Detroit, where the season would end
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore emphasized the importance of playing small ball and fundamentally sound baseball to avoid further losses
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox have the fewest hits, the fewest home runs, and the worst team batting average in the major leagues this season
The team has posted 14 losing streaks of four games or more, the longest lasting 21 games from mid-July through early August
